goals.question: What is the distribution of wind speed?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind speeds and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind_speed vs wind_direction
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and wind direction.

goals.question: What is the average wind speed by month?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average wind_speed by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any seasonal trends in wind speed.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wind direction?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind directions and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind_speed vs temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and temperature.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['wind_speed'] = pd.to_numeric(data['wind_speed'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['wind_speed'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['wind_speed'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Wind Speed')
    plt.axvline(data['wind_speed'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['wind_speed'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wind speed?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['wind_speed'], data['wind_direction'], alpha=0.5)
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Wind Direction')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    data['month'] = data['date'].dt.to_period('M')
    monthly_avg_wind_speed = data.groupby('month')['wind_speed'].mean()

    plt.plot(monthly_avg_wind_speed.index.to_timestamp(), monthly_avg_wind_speed, label='Average Wind Speed')
    plt.axhline(monthly_avg_wind_speed.mean(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f"Overall Average: {monthly_avg_wind_speed.mean():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('Average Wind Speed')
    plt.title('What is the average wind speed by month?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['wind_direction'].plot(kind='hist', bins=20, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.title("What is the distribution of wind direction?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Wind Direction")
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.legend(["Wind Direction"])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['wind_speed'], data['temperature'])
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(['Wind Speed vs Temperature'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
